intro: Lowianthus borneensis, commonly known as the Bornean lowianthus, is a flowering plant native to the island of Borneo. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments within tropical rainforests. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are small and yellowish in color. Lowianthus borneensis is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and limited distribution.
